com.github.uberroot.ncjbot

Class ProcessorNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.ProcessorNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UnsafeObject<ProcessorNode>

    public final class ProcessorNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnsafeObject<ProcessorNode>

    This is the main portion of the program. It is responsible for connecting to the network, managing the various supporting threads, and shutting down the node / gracefully disconnecting from the network.

    Additionally, this class is responsible for starting, monitoring, and signaling jobs running on this node. For more on the loading and running of individual jobs, see ProcessorJobEnvironment.

    The supporting classes use this class as a proxy for all communication, retrieving the instances of each other from this class.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

      The NetworkManager for this node.
      private ServerThread servThread
      The thread that handles incoming socket communication.
      private java.lang.String status
      The current status string of this node.
      private Watchdog watchdog
      The Watchdog for monitoring remote nodes running locally initiated jobs.

      • ProcessorNode

               throws java.io.IOException

      • main

                 throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments. This is ignored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        ProcessorNode()

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Closes all connections and threads and allows the node to gracefully quit.

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()

        Gets the current status string of the node.

        Valid Values:
        • I'm not dead yet. The node is active.
        • I'm bleeding out. The node is shutting down.
        Returns:
        The current status string of the node.

      • getListenPort

        public int getListenPort()

        Gets the current port on which the server socket should listen.

        Returns:
        The current port on which the server socket should listen.

      • addDiscoveredNode

        public boolean addDiscoveredNode(RemoteNode rn)

        Refreshes the status of the given node and adds it to the active node list if it is not already there.

        Parameters:
        rn - The node to add / refresh.
        Returns:
        False if the node already existed in the active node list, true if it did not.

      • startJob

        public long startJob(java.lang.String classPath,
            java.lang.String className,
            RemoteNode source,
            java.lang.String remotePid,
            java.io.File initData,
            boolean cleanup)

        Starts a new job on its own thread with the given parameters.

        Parameters:
        classPath - The path to the running directory for the job to be created. This is also the path to the class file for the job.
        className - The name of the ProcessorJob subclass to run.
        source - The node that sent the job, or null if it was locally created.
        remotePid - The thread id of the remote job that sent the job, or null if it was locally created.
        initData - Initialization parameters for the job to be created.
        cleanup - Whether to delete the class files and directory after it finishes running.
        Returns:
        The thread id of the new job, or -1 on failure.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String destPid,
            java.lang.String sourcePid,
            RemoteNode source,
            java.io.File data)

        Delivers data from a remote job to a job running on this node.

        Parameters:
        destPid - The thread id of the destination job running on this node.
        sourcePid - The thread id of the source job for the data.
        source - The node from which the data originated
        data - The data to deliver.

      • announceFoundNode

        public void announceFoundNode(RemoteNode rn)

        Alerts the jobs currently running on this node to a new node on the network.

        Parameters:
        rn - The discovered node.

      • announceNodeFailure

        public void announceNodeFailure(RemoteNode rn)

        Alerts the jobs currently running on this node to a failure of a node on the network. This indicates that the job should assume everything running on that node was lost.

        Parameters:
        rn - The node that failed.

      • getNetworkManager

        public NetworkManager getNetworkManager()

        Retrieves the running NetworkManager for this node.

        Returns:
        The running NetworkManager for this node.

        The running Watchdog for this node.
